originalText.text: I spent 28 days in the shwartz and I had to deal with a window falling in on me @ 7 bed then moved to 17 & again moved to 27 from which I left their. During my stay all of the bad things said where some what in evidence, however the director & his assistant+ some very conscientious R.A.s & security staff helped not just myself but many others this I did observe first hand. That being said the clients Whom aren't doing anything positive for themselves is always going to be an extreme challenge to put it politely ðŸ˜Ž So it's up to each one of us to challenge our selves to be more than the sum of are parts. P.S. the food has gotten a lot better under the shakes directionðŸ¤“ this was my experience @ the VOA aka the shwartz.

originalText.text: #homelesssocially #sociallyhomeless No Macbook's allowed so find a place for it, YMCA membership with locker works. Breakfast good if you love french toast, pancakes. :-) #wardislandnewyork @newyorkmayor @newyorkmayoroffice

text.text: #homelesssocially #sociallyhomeless No Macbook's allowed so find a place for it, YMCA membership with locker works. Breakfast good if you love french toast, pancakes. :-) #wardislandnewyork @newyorkmayor @newyorkmayoroffice

originalText.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. The case managers are rude and incompetent. They don't give a rat's ass about anyone in there. The security guards are disrespectful and unprofessional. The place is basically hell on earth. They still use paperwork and can't keep track. This place is literally like taking a step back 30 years in time. The food is disgusting and not nutritious. You may be better off sleeping on a sidewalk in the city then dealing with unprofessional, incompetent people like these.

originalText.text: I have been here a month and a half or so, staff here treat you like trash, Everytime they don't get their way with you, they always threaten to take away your bed, DHS officers threaten people with summons just because residents are recording them for the stupidity that they do, like bring drugs into the shelter and getting paid for it by some residents, bringing in food and liquor for some residents as well, going into the dorms and talking on their cell phones not doing their job.  Case Managers always threaten not to give people metro cards so they can't go to their appointments thinking residents are going to sell the cards.  They also do a head count from 10am to 2am 7 days a week, turn off the lights at 12 midnight, with still a lot of traffic coming in and out of the dorms, people smoking weed, cigarettes, sniffing cocaine, doing needles, doing K2 in bed and in bathroom stalls, they then turn all the lights on at 6am and everyone has to be out of the dorms by 9am meaning no sleep at all, plus many people steal in the dorms...

Case Managers always threaten not to give people metro cards so they can't go to their appointments thinking residents are going to sell the cards.  They also do a head count from 10am to 2am 7 days a week, turn off the lights at 12 midnight, with still a lot of traffic coming in and out of the dorms, people smoking weed, cigarettes, sniffing cocaine, doing needles, doing K2 in bed and in bathroom stalls, they then turn all the lights on at 6am and everyone has to be out of the dorms by 9am meaning no sleep at all, plus many people steal in the dorms...

originalText.text: Because of how rude and offensive one Nancy Fullerton was to me when I was trying to donate I will no longer be supporting them. It seems treating people poorly is just par for the course for this place. I think alligators might be have a better temperament. In any case I strongly urge people to vote with their money, and find a better place to support. Or to the board you get rid of people like Nancy. Maybe then people like myself will support you again before you get cut right out of existence.
